intro: Pentapetes suberifolia, commonly known as the hairy pentapetes, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both ecological and horticultural studies.
